node.title: SA Police search for medi-hotel escapee who allegedly provided false ID
node.alt: CCTV showing a woman who allegedly absconded from an Adelaide medi-hotel.
node.description: South Australian police are searching for a woman who allegedly provided false identification details and escaped from a medi-hotel in Adelaide's CBD.
node.content:
["South Australian police are searching for a woman who allegedly provided false identification details and\u00a0escaped from a medi-hotel in Adelaide's CBD.", "Police said the woman arrived from Darwin and was taken to a COVID-19\u00a0quarantine hotel in Adelaide, but \"absconded\" yesterday.", "She left the hotel about 7:45pm.", "\"It will be alleged she provided false identification to police on arrival in South Australia,\" police said.", "\"The woman tested negative to COVID-19 on arrival.\"", "Police said the woman was last seen wearing the same outfit as in the CCTV image they have released.", "They suspect she got into a taxi near the intersection of Rundle Mall and Pulteney Street.", "Police have asked anyone who knows the woman's identity or whereabouts to contact them immediately on 131 444.", "A media conference on the matter will be held shortly.", "The incident is the latest alleged breach of hotel quarantine, and comes after a young woman and man were arrested after allegedly being caught in the same room\u00a0of an Adelaide medi-hotel.", "In August, a\u00a0New South Wales man was\u00a0sentenced to 14 days in prison after he escaped from\u00a0hotel quarantine to visit\u00a0a\u00a0pub.", "", "
Do we really need booster shots for COVID-19?
"]
